events.title: Start of the Wars of the Roses
events.description: The First Battle of St Albans marks the beginning of the Wars of the Roses in England, a series of civil wars for control of the throne between the houses of Lancaster and York.
events.significance: This battle initiated decades of dynastic conflict shaping English history and monarchy.

events.title: Abolition of the British Slave Trade
events.description: The British Parliament passes the Slave Trade Act 1807, abolishing the transatlantic slave trade within the British Empire.
events.significance: This marked a major step towards ending slavery and influenced abolition movements worldwide.

events.title: The Oregon Treaty Signed
events.description: The United States and United Kingdom sign the Oregon Treaty, peacefully settling the Oregon boundary dispute by establishing the 49th parallel as the border between U.S. and British territories in the Pacific Northwest.
events.significance: The treaty helped avoid war and shaped the present-day U.S.-Canada border in that region.

events.title: Man Walks on the Moon for the Last Time
events.description: NASA astronaut Eugene Cernan, commander of Apollo 17, becomes the last person to walk on the Moon as the Apollo program concludes.
events.significance: This event marked the end of an era in lunar exploration that inspired science and technology worldwide.
